title: non-format
content:
To aviod disturbing [these genious](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.non-format.com/) I'll post a question here. Could anybody tell me where to look for the fons they use? Or consruct and use... Do the sell these or it's just a lettering not a font? Any analogs available for purchase?  
Thanks
author: onki

comments.content: Most of their typography is derived from modifying existing typefaces. If you give a specific example I'm sure someone here could sort it out.

I am a new member - can hardly post the image... and their page is built on flash so I can't post the direct link... =)  
But I'm talking about their Extra FATS. If go there and click on 09 you'll see what I mean exactly...  
probably I've managed to insert a pic... probably not=))
It’s probably what they use throughout their site: ITC Serif Gothic, but with an extra thick outline stroke added.

I'll just go ahead and post this again:

**Heavy Geometric Retro Deco ’80s Sans**  
 [Black Boton Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/black_boton_bold/)  
 [Frank](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.neutura.org/Frank.html)  
 [Deuce](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.neutura.org/Deuce.html)  
 [Mostra Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/mark_simonson/mostra_blk_one_two_three/)  
 [Blocks](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/blocks/?sample_text=TOTALLY%20NU%20RAVE&sample_size=36)  
 [Alpha Bloc Sculpture](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/font_bureau/alpha_bloc_sculpture/)  
 [FF Extra](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_extra/)  
 [Unovis](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/paratype/unovis_regular_ot/)  
 [Neutrino](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.neutura.org/Neutrino.html)  
 [Toch](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/lamosca.com/)  
 [NB Block](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.neubauladen.com/catalogue/NB-Typografie/3/NBBlock%E2%84%A2/1310/1)  
 [Acton](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/device_fonts/acton/)  
 [Bebit](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.paratype.com/pstore/default.asp?fcode=TM_BBT&letter=B) (Cyrillic version of Milton Glaser's Baby Teeth)  
 [Parkitecture](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/parkitecture/regular/?refby=typographica)  
 [Wagner Silhouette](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/wagner-silhouette-nf/)  
 [Rody](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/discourse/rody/?refby=typographica) and [Lazar](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/discourse/lazar/?refby=typographica)  
 [Milford](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sparkytype/milford/?refby=typographica)  
 [Cooter](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=NzA=)  
 [Douff](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/2rebels/doufff/)

Free  
 [Spokes](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/down10.com/fonts/spokes.html)  
 [Disco Deck](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.dafont.com/font.php?file=disco_deck)  
 [Pacmania Normal](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.abstractfonts.com/font/1580)  
 [Fatti Patti](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/casady_greene/d_h.htm) (lame version of Baby Teeth)  
 [Lovers Square](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.happyloverstown.eu/wordpress/)  
 [Pimp](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.formlos.net/formlosTF/Pimp)

Custom  
 [Non-Format](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.non-format.com/) created a bunch of these for their design work.

Soft and Round  
 [Deuce Round](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.neutura.org/DeuceRound.html)  
 [Copal](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/copal_std_ot/)  
 [NB Rund](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.neubauladen.com/catalogue/NB-Typography/3/NBFett%E2%84%A2/1044/1)  
 [Umma Gommma](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.happyloverstown.eu/wordpress/)  
 [Gusto](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/device_fonts/gusto/)  
 [Fatty](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MTIw)

I made my avatar probably in the same way they do their stuff.  
It's basically a heavily modified sans serif. Although they also do serifs, but those looks kinda odd.
To answer the original question, the Non-Format fonts are probably not for sale.
Thanks once again... spend several hours to observe all the pages.

Take a look [**here**](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.neubauladen.com/catalogue/NB-Typografie/3), but I agree with Ricardo: I think that those are customized and exclusive ones... ;-)

**How long does it take you to develop one of your custom typefaces?**  
**JF** : It depends on the typeface. Sometimes we work quite quickly and they’re exactly what we want for the job. Others need more work.  
**KE** : Some won’t be the whole alphabet either, just the letters that you need. Then later you might go back to them.  
**JF** : It might look great for the letters you need but might not for the rest of the alphabet. We had that with the Wire – we hoped and prayed that they wouldn’t write a headline with a Z in it! We didn’t have one.

Source: [**CR Blog**](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225230713/http:/www.creativereview.co.uk/crblog/dear-non-format/)
The new non-format book includes citations for all the fonts used.
The new non-format book includes citations for all the fonts used.
Nice to know that, jackson! I've seen the book in stores and can't wait to get a copy. :-)
